description.narrative: The project is expected to: i) Help the country achieve its climate change mitigation targets by providing the first blue financing loan in the country and the region. Entire proceeds of IFC's loan will be used for financing eligible blue projects in Romania in line with IFC's Guidelines for Blue Finance. ii) Promote the blue finance concept in the market, eventually prompting other systemic banks to follow on with their own blue finance transactions, thus increasing the blue financing available in the country. iii) Enhance the resilience of Romanian banking sector by supporting the first MREL debt of the largest bank in the country. The proposed project is part of IFC's program to promote capital market deepening and financial sector resilience in Romania.

The proposed project is to provide a seven-year senior non-preferred (SNP) loan of up to EUR100 million equivalent to Banca Transilvania S.A. (BT or the Bank), to be disbursed in EUR or RON. The loan will comply with the EUs Bank Resolution and Recovery Directive (BRRD), helping the Bank to achieve its regulatory MREL (Minimum Requirement for Own Funds) targets. The proceeds from IFCs investment will be on-lent to eligible MSMEs in Romania and used for financing eligible blue projects in the country in line with IFCs Guidelines for Blue Finance, including sustainable manufacturing, tourism, fishing; water treatment and management; sustainable agriculture irrigation practices; and other sectors that would contribute to sustainable use of water resources for economic growth.
